profileAlternative.name: Ben Stacey
profileAlternative.headline: Enterprise Account Executive at MongoDB
profileAlternative.summary:
I am a highly driven professional, working for MongoDB , the leading next generation database.

What drew me to MongoDB was how quickly it was making strides in a rapidly growing market, ripe for disruption, due to the pain caused from legacy systems that are simply no longer able meet modern demands. Our value proposition transforms the way businesses process and harness their data & technology, to maximize competitive advantage & accelerate time to value ,whilst dramatically reducing total cost of ownership vs incumbent vendors across software, hardware and people.

This, has led to over 50 million downloads, 8500 satisfied customers and MongoDB becoming the only database public company to successfully IPO in the last 20 years.

I enjoy speaking to people who are interested in learning how to harness MongoDB to transform their business - If you'd like to organise an initial chat or cup of coffee, please feel free to contact me via Linkedin.

When not at the office, I enjoy nothing more then spending time with friends socializing, cracking jokes and a bit of banter.

positions.title: Enterprise Account Executive
positions.description:
MongoDB is the leading next generation database. Designed for how we build and run applications today, MongoDB empowers organisations to be more agile and scalable. It enables new types of applications, better customer experience, faster time to market and lower costs for organisations of all sizes.

MongoDB is a multi-model, general purpose database. It features:
Document data model with dynamic schemas
Full, flexible index support and rich queries
Auto-Sharding for horizontal scalability
Built-in replication for high availability
Text search
Advanced security
Aggregation Framework and MapReduce
Large media storage with GridFS

Try MongoDB: http://www.mongodb.org/
Learn the Basics for Free: https://education.mongodb.com/
Production Deployments: http://www.mongodb.org/about/production-deployments/
Cloud Management Services: https://mms.mongodb.com/

positions.title: Amazon Web Services
positions.description:
Field based role, responsible for Engineering & Pharmaceutical verticals

Launched in 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) began exposing key infrastructure services to businesses in the form of web services -- now widely known as cloud computing. The ultimate benefit of cloud computing, and AWS, is the ability to leverage a new business model and turn capital infrastructure expenses into variable costs. Businesses no longer need to plan and procure servers and other IT resources weeks or months in advance. Using AWS, businesses can take advantage of Amazon's expertise and economies of scale to access resources when their business needs them, delivering results faster and at a lower cost.

Today, Amazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. With data center locations in the U.S., Europe, Singapore, and Japan, customers across all industries are taking advantage of our low cost, elastic, open and flexible, secure platform.

received.text:
EJ elevates the recruiting profession and sets the bar for which all other recruiters should strive for. 

EJ is passionate about what she does and it shows in her actions through every stage of the recruitment process. Through proper screening, EJ seeks to understand her candidates strengths, what drives them and what opportunity would best match to excel her candidates career.

During the interview process, EJ provided fantastic coaching and guidance, all the while, conducting it in a friendly manner that is fun and easy to work with. 

Last but not least, the fact EJ wasn’t even representing me directly, yet still took time to help prepare and coach, shows how passionate she is about representing true talent in London. 

I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend EJ to anyone who is looking for a recruiting professional, who’s truly vested in their candidates success.

Liam is one of the most successful colleagues I have worked with in my career to date. 

Soon after joining AWS, Liam quickly identified a substantial opportunity working with some of the UK’s most strategic startup’s. Liam then took it upon himself to not only create and define the role, but based on his success, was able to lead the growth of the segment, into what is now one of the most profitable areas of the business for AWS in the UK. 

It was a pleasure working with Liam and I look forward to following his career, as I've no doubt he will continue his current trajectory. Onwards.
